SEARCH
Package org.hms.services.authentication

Class AuthenticationService

java.lang.Object
org.hms.services.authentication.AuthenticationService
public class AuthenticationService extends Object
The AuthenticationService class provides functionalities for user authentication, user management, and password management. This class manages user login, password changes, account locking due to failed login attempts, and various user-related operations including adding, deleting, and searching users.

  • Field Details

    • dataRoot

      private static final String dataRoot
      The root directory for storing application data files. This path is dynamically set to the current working directory of the user, appended with "/data/".

    • USER_DB_FILE

      private static final String USER_DB_FILE
      The file path for the user database, combining the root directory path with the specific filename for storing user data. This constant points to a CSV file that stores user information such as ID, password, role, and first login status.

    • ID_PREFIXES

      private static final Map<UserRole,String> ID_PREFIXES
      A map that associates each UserRole with a specific ID prefix. This is used in the system to generate unique IDs for users based on their role. The keys of the map are UserRole values, and the values are the corresponding ID prefixes. For example, the prefix for DOCTOR is "DOC", for PATIENT is "PAT", etc.

    • loginAttemptTracker

      private final LoginAttemptTracker loginAttemptTracker
      Tracks user login attempts and manages account lockout timing.

      This variable is responsible for: - Recording the number of failed login attempts for each user. - Locking out accounts after a specified number of failed login attempts. - Clearing the number of failed attempts and lockout status for users. - Checking if an account is currently locked out. - Providing information on the remaining login attempts and lockout end times.

    • users

      private Map<String,User> users
      A map storing user data within the system. The key is a unique identifier for each user, and the value is a User object representing the user's information including ID, password, role, and login status. This map is used for managing user accounts, handling authentication, and performing various user-related operations in the AuthenticationService.

    • currentUser

      private User currentUser
      Represents the currently authenticated user in the system. This variable is set upon successful login and cleared upon logout.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthenticationService

      public AuthenticationService()
      Constructs an instance of AuthenticationService and initializes its internal state. This includes setting up the user storage mechanism, tracking login attempts, and loading users from a persistent storage.

      The constructor performs the following operations: - Initializes the users map to store user information. - Sets up an instance of LoginAttemptTracker for managing login attempts and account lockouts. - Calls initializeUserDatabase to set up the user database if it doesn't exist. - Calls loadUsers to load existing user information from the database into memory.

  • Method Details

    • initializeUserDatabase

      private void initializeUserDatabase()
      Initializes the user database by creating necessary directories and files. If the user database file does not exist, it will be created with a default admin account. The default admin account will have a hashed password.

      This method ensures that the directory specified by `dataRoot` exists, and initializes the user database file with the necessary headers and a default user. If the file already exists, it skips the initialization.

      Handles IOException during directory and file creation.

    • loadUsers

      private void loadUsers()
      Loads user data from a file into the system.

      This method reads the user data from a predefined file and populates the internal user map with user objects. Each user record in the file is expected to have four fields: user ID, hashed password, role, and a flag indicating if it is the user's first login.

      The file format must be a comma-separated values (CSV) file with the following columns: id,password,role,isFirstLogin

      If a line in the file has exactly four fields, a new User object is created and added to the users map. The users map uses the user ID as the key and the User object as the value.

      This method uses a try-with-resources statement to ensure that the file reader is properly closed after use.

      If an IOException occurs during the reading process, an error message is printed to the console.

      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • saveUsers

      private void saveUsers()
      Persists the current state of users to the user database file. This method writes user details such as id, password (hashed), role, and first login status to a CSV file for storage and future retrieval. The file writing process handles I/O exceptions, printing an error message if any issues occur during saving.

    • login

      public AuthenticationResult login(String id, String password)
      Authenticates a user with the provided ID and password. This method performs several checks, including verifying user existence, account lock status, and password correctness. If authentication is successful, the user's login attempts are cleared and they are set as the current user.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the user attempting to log in.
      password - The password provided by the user for authentication.
      Returns:
      An AuthenticationResult object representing the outcome of the authentication attempt.

    • changePassword

      public boolean changePassword(String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the password for the currently logged-in user.
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - the current password of the user
      newPassword - the new password to be set
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully changed, false otherwise

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user by setting the currentUser field to null.

      This method is typically called when a user chooses to log out from the system. After calling this method, no user will be considered as logged in until a subsequent login operation is successfully performed.

    • getCurrentUser

      public User getCurrentUser()
      Retrieves the current authenticated user.
      Returns:
      the current User object, or null if no user is authenticated

    • generateUniqueId

      private String generateUniqueId(UserRole role)
      Generates a unique ID for a user based on their role. The ID is composed of a prefix corresponding to the user role and a numeric suffix that increments from the highest existing numerical suffix for that role.
      Parameters:
      role - The role of the user for which the unique ID is generated.
      Returns:
      The generated unique ID as a string.

    • addUser

      public String addUser(UserRole role)
      Adds a new user to the system with the specified role.
      Parameters:
      role - the role assigned to the new user
      Returns:
      the unique identifier of the newly added user

    • addUserWithId

      public boolean addUserWithId(String id, UserRole role)
      Adds a new user with the specified ID and role.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the new user
      role - the role assigned to the new user
      Returns:
      true if the user was added successfully, false if a user with the given ID already exists

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all users currently in the system.
      Returns:
      a List containing all User objects

    • getUsersByRole

      public List<User> getUsersByRole(UserRole role)
      Fetches a list of users filtered by their specified role.
      Parameters:
      role - The role used as a filter criterion to retrieve users.
      Returns:
      A list of users that have the specified role.

    • getUsersByRole

      public List<User> getUsersByRole(UserRole role, boolean sortById)
      Retrieves a list of Users by their role, with an option to sort them by their ID.
      Parameters:
      role - the role of the users to retrieve
      sortById - flag indicating whether the result should be sorted by user ID
      Returns:
      a list of users with the specified role, optionally sorted by user ID

    • searchUsersByIdPrefix

      public List<User> searchUsersByIdPrefix(String idPrefix)
      Searches for users whose IDs start with the given prefix.
      Parameters:
      idPrefix - the prefix to search for in user IDs
      Returns:
      a list of users whose IDs start with the provided prefix

    • userExists

      public boolean userExists(String id)
      Checks if a user with the specified ID exists in the user database.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the user
      Returns:
      true if the user exists, false otherwise

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser(String id)
      Deletes a user identified by the given ID from the user database.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully deleted, false if the user does not exist.

    • getUser

      public Optional<User> getUser(String id)
      Retrieves a user by their unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, otherwise an empty Optional

    • getUserCount

      public int getUserCount()
      Retrieves the total number of users currently present in the system.
      Returns:
      the total count of users

    • getUserCountByRole

      public long getUserCountByRole(UserRole role)
      Retrieves the count of users that have a specific role.
      Parameters:
      role - the role for which to count the users
      Returns:
      the number of users with the specified role
